title.narrative: NUTRITION OP 1 GOVERNANCE

description.narrative: By 2023, government's capacity is enhanced for improved governance of nutrition across a multi-system enabled environment, including disaster risk reduction, which contributes to Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, Government has the capacity at national and decentralized level to improve policy, planning, monitoring, coordination and resource leveraging of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) programme for equitable and sustainable access to climate resilient Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services at scale

sector.narrative: National multisectoral strategies and plans to prevent stunting and wasting (excludes intervention specific strategies)
Strengthening data and national information systems, including routine systems, nutrition surveys and assessments (early childhood nutrition)
Technical assistance - Nutrition in early childhood

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, government's capacity is enhanced for improved governance of nutrition across a multi-system enabled environment,including disaster risk reduction

description.narrative: Despite the restrictions due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the National Office of Nutrition (ONN) initiated the development of the new National Nutrition Policy and the National Nutrition Plan 2022-2026. Government-led programs aiming at improving young children&39;s dietary diversity have been initiated across several regions with technical and financial support from UNICEF including using multi-systems approach. As a response to the drought emergency, UNICEF strengthened the Nutrition Cluster coordination and assisted with production of strategic data on the nutrition situation of children in Madagascar including in emergency context. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:10/01/2022

title.narrative: Existence of a functional cluster coordination for nutrition, Text

baseline.value: Coordination mechanism exists but no TOR, mapping or performance measurement system

target.value: 2023:Coordination mechanism exists but no TOR, mapping, partners convened response plan developed and performance measurement system

Implementation of programmes to improve diet diversity in children, Text

baseline.value: Zero to one (out of 9) programme is implemented by the government to improve diversity of diets in children aged 6 to 23 months

target.value: 2023:Six to seven (out of 9) programmes are implemented by the government
